page.title: 04Fox's Dairy
page.content:
Fox's Dairy is a distribution depot. The bottling takes place at Northern Dairies in Middlesbrough. The Dairy is a family business having been started by Mr Fox's grandfather.
The first floats leave at 4.30am and return at 10am. As well as selling milk they also sell other dairy products such as eggs, butter, cream and yoghurt. They also carry small amounts of potatoes and bread, earning the milkmen commission.
The average amount of milk carried each day is 9,700 pints of pastuerised milk and 2,700 pints of semi-skilled milk. They also deliver 1,300 cartons of milk to the shops. The milk floats are electric so they have to be recharged every day. They can travel 40 miles on a full charge.
